text:
Hey HubSpot Legends!

<@U7W5SDG3D> and I at iGoMoon have just released a new version of `@igomoon/HubSpot-fields-js`

Thank you for the support from everyone so far, it’s come far in the last 9 months and sill has a ways to go, we’d love to here your feedback on this and to hear how it helps.

Our end goal is to make this accessible for all HS developers and eventually combine it with the `hs upload` command.

*Link to Package*: <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@igomoon/HubSpot-fields-js>
*Helper Video for new features*: <http://videos.igomoon.com/watch/CMfxfLo9u941xPWq9RunuC>?

For those looking foe the cli versions to run alongside `hs watch` , you can find it here
<https://www.npmjs.com/package/@igomoon/HubSpot-fields-js-cli>

Wanted to pull down and experiment with the Growth Theme this morning but I’m running into an upload error for some of the default CSS files… anyone else run into this error with this theme?

```[ERROR] Uploading file "[system path]/Growth/css/elements/_forms.css" to "Growth/css/elements/_forms.css" failed
[ERROR] Unable to upload "[system path]/Growth/css/elements/_forms.css". The post to "Growth/css/elements/_forms.css" in account XXXXXXX failed due to a server error. Please try again or visit <https://help.HubSpot.com/> to submit a ticket or contact HubSpot Support if the issue persists. internal error
[ERROR] Uploading file "[system path]/Growth/css/theme-overrides.css" to "Growth/css/theme-overrides.css" failed
[ERROR] Unable to upload "[system path]/Growth/css/theme-overrides.css". The post to "Growth/css/theme-overrides.css" in account XXXXXXX failed due to a server error. Please try again or visit <https://help.HubSpot.com/> to submit a ticket or contact HubSpot Support if the issue persists. internal error```

I usually just go directly in the design manager on the HubSpot folder and clone the theme from here (all HubSpot themes are already there by default, so you just need to clone it to start modifying it)
I think it might have been due to the folder name? Not sure, uploaded to _Growth instead of Growth and it worked. Weird, but thanks <@UV23JHEJY>
